_comment: Created by hdorning on 23/08/2017 15:41:17 using v2.7
title: How many days in total are patients delayed and how has this changed?
analysis_commentary:
Despite individual monthly fluctuations, the total number of days patients are delayed per month has increased over time from 108,064 in April 2011, to 177,137 in April 2017 and it reached a maximum of 200,095 delayed days in October 2016.

There was an increase in the number of delayed days occurring as of April 2014. Some of this will be because of the increases in the number of patients delayed observed in the above chart. However, it is difficult to determine whether this is the sole contributory factor or if patients are also waiting longer than before.

Updated July 2017.
